S.2. A regular and comprehensive
Orientation Program is held for
new, returning and continuing
students.
Cavite State University- Trece Martires City Campus

Republic of the Philippines CAVITE STATE UNIVERSITY Tanza ǀ Trece Martires City ǀ Gen. Trias City Campus  414-3979 ǀ  (0977)8033809 ǀ  509-4148 www.cvsu.edu.ph
PARENTS AND STUDENTS VIRTUAL ORIENTATION ON THE CvSU T3 CAMPUSES IMPLEMENTATION OF FLEXIBLE LEARNING DELIVERY MODE 05 September 2020 at 1:30PM via
Rationale On 08 March 2020, through Proclamation No. 922 s, 2020, the country was declared in a state of public health emergency because of the outbreak of Corona Virus Disease (COVID-19). Another Proclamation No. 929 on 16 March 2020 was released declaring a state of calamity throughout the Philippines because of COVID-19 pandemic. With these and the Inter-agency Task Force for the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases (IATF) Resolutions, Commission on Higher Education released CHED COVID Advisory No. 7, providing guidelines on the HEIs operation and work arrangements. The use of flexible learning delivery mode was also provided for guidance. Cavite State University through the Academic Affairs Unit continuously provide webinars and trainings to prepare the faculty members with the flexible learning and other alternative modes of delivery for the AY 2020-2021. And with the series of webinars and trainings, the CvSU T3 Campuses come up with different strategies on how flexible learning will be possible. Together with the faculty members, students and parents should also be informed on how the flexible learning will be conducted in the First Semester, AY 2020-2021 through an orientation.
Objectives The activity aimed to provide a clearer understanding on how the flexible learning will be conducted in the T3 Campuses for the First Semester, AY 2020-2021 and at the same time come up with a united desire on how to provide quality education to students despite the pandemic.
Program of Activities The program started at 1:30PM by a prayer followed by the CvSU at a Glance video presentation.

The CvSU Calendar of Activities for AY 2020-2021 was presented by Ms. Vienna Mi A. Ferail, T3 Curriculum Development and Instruction Head. She also discussed the CvSU T3 Campuses Flexible Learning Delivery Modes.
The CvSU eLearning System was discussed and presented by Ms. Charmaine T. Banag and Mr. Jeffrey M. Delgado, IT Faculty Members of CvSU Tanza Campus.

Afterwards, Mr. Keno A. Villavicencio and Ms. Pamela Daphne R. Busog, IT Faculty
Members of CvSU Trece Martires City Campus discussed GSuite for Education.

Then, the Open Forum proceeds with Mr. Gideon Luke P. Ty (Admission Officer- Trece), as the Moderator. The panel are composed of Prof. Noel A. Sedigo (T3 Campus Administrator), Ms. Mildred A. Sebastian (Campus Coordinator-Tanza), Ms. Lilian O. Sidamon (Campus Coordinator-Trece), Ms. Shaine C. Hayag (Campus Coordinator-Gen. Trias), Ms. Vienna Mi A. Feranil (T3 Curriculum Development and Instruction Head), Mr. Keno A. Villavicencio (IT Department Chairperson-Trece), Ms. Pamela Daphne R. Busog (MIS Coordinator-Trece), Ms. Charmaine T. Banag (MIS Coordinator-Tanza), Mr. Jeffrey M. Delgado (IT Faculty Member-Tanza), Mr. Mark Joel C. Sibulo (Admission Officer-Tanza), Ms. Mary Ann L. Anonas (Registrar-Trece), Ms. Noemi A. Perida (Registrar Aide-Tanza), and Ms. Rogelyn P. Alarca (Admin Officer-Gen. Trias) to answer the questions.
Question and Answer Question (BSP 1-Trece): Do we need books in our subjects? Answer (Ms. Feranil): Books are not required, but there are books which are already reviewed, evaluated, and approved by the University Textbook Board especially in General Education subjects that may be used as references.
Question (BSP 1-Trece): Do we need to pay any fees? Answer (Ms. Feranil): No fees will be collected because of the RA 10931 or the Free Tertiary Education.
Question (Tanza Student): Who will decide on the type of platform to use in learning, whether CvSU eLearning o Google classroom, is it the student? Answer (Ms. Villavicencio): Faculty members will define the type of platform to use.
Question (First Year-Trece): What will happen to those students who are qualified for admission but did not able to submit original admission requirements? Answer (Ms. Anonas): Students are temporary enrolled unless original admission requirements are submitted.

Question (Tanza Student): Are you going to provide each student an account to access the eLearning System? Answer (Ms. Busog): Yes, but we are still waiting for the account from Main Campus.
Question (BSP 1-Trece): How would be the distribution of modules and submission of activities for those who prefer modular mode of learning? Answer (Ms. Feranil): There are assigned day for each program, for the pickup of learning materials and submission of activities in the campus as stated in the virtual class schedule provided.
Question (BSBM-Trece): What will happen if we are taking online quiz, and there were technical interruptions, is the system capable of saving the status of our quiz? Answer (Ms. Banag): Yes, it may be saved. The Instructor will just set the time for the quiz.
Question (BSIT Parent): Will the University provide the students with a copy of University Academic Calendar and the tutorial on how to use the system and take the examinations? Answer (Mr. Villavicencio): Yes, calendar will be provided to students through Facebook page the same with the tutorial which was presented earlier. Since this orientation is in FB Live, students may review or replay the tutorial anytime since this will not be deleted anymore. And at the same time, during the first week of class orientation, Instructors will discuss again the process of using the learning platform.
Question (BSHRM-Trece): When will we have our OJT which are scheduled last Midterm? Answer (Ms. Sidamon): OJTs are allowed if it is online.
Question (GenTri Student): I am a working student; can I still attend to online classes? Answer (Prof. Sedigo): Yes, you may. Because we discourage synchronous classes.
Question (Trece Student): Are the learning materials downloadable? Answer (Mr. Ty): Yes, all learning materials once uploaded to the platform are ready for download anytime as long as you have your device.
Question (First Year Student): Are we required to attend online class in uniform? Do we need to buy one? Answer (Ms. Feranil): No, just wear appropriate outfit that is appealing to the class.
Question (Gen. Trias Student): How sure that the answers to online exams taken by students are authentic, since they could search the net while taking the exam? Answer (Mr. Villavicencio): College set up is different from high school or senior high school. Examinations are skill based and not knowledge based only. Questions can be reshuffled, have timer and other strategies, your instructors may set it.
Question: Which is the best mode of learning? Answer (Prof. Sedigo): Modular mode of learning are very risky for everyone. Since, there are limited transportation and at the same time there is increasing number of COVID cases in the area. But if you really prefer the modular type, modules will be available in a designated area in the campus entrance where you can get your modules. But if you want it to be delivered to your doorsteps, yes, it is possible, but you will shoulder the cost of shipping. But we cannot give you the whole semester module because that is so many pages. That is why we discourage the modular type of learning. Unlike online, materials will be uploaded to the LMS or Google classroom or could be send to you through fb messenger, chat groups, email or even text messages. Synchronous classes are discouraged, so meaning, if you will have the online, it is not necessary that you spend load for the data daily for zoom classes, no. We will have the asynchronous type of teaching and learning. Because our motto is NO ONE SHOULD BE LEFT BEHIND. Online is more advantageous, cheaper, or safer rather than modular. Another thing, we should also invest on this. Especially IT students, not only connectivity but also having a laptop is necessary in your program.

Question (BSE Student): Do we have the qualifying examination schedule? If ever, will it be online? Answer (Mr. Ty): There are previous announcements that it will be scheduled in latter part. Answer (Prof. Sedigo): The qualifying exam is still face to face and is probably scheduled in January 2021.
Question: Do we need to pay for the printing of modules? Answer (Mr. Ty): No payment. It is free for students because CHED paid for their tuition and school fees.
Question (Gen. Trias Student): How about the academic scholars? Answer (Ms. Sidamon): Only Tulong Dulong and TES are active scholarship grant for this semester.
Question (BSE Student): If we have 3-hour virtual class schedule, do we need to attend 3 hours virtual class also? Answer (Ms. Feranil): No, we prepared the virtual class schedule for you to be aware of the available schedule for the teacher for consultation and possible queries or clarifications on the lesson. This flexible learning is a self-paced learning, so you can do the readings or studying in your convenient time not necessarily during the virtual class schedule. In addition, attendance is not part of the grading system for this semester. Answer (Prof. Sedigo): In addition, during virtual class schedule, that is the time that the teacher will post the lessons and made himself available to students’ consultations.
Question (Parent): I am an OFW parent, can I monitor my child’s performance in the online learning platform? Answer (Ms. Busog): Yes, if the student will allow their parents to access his/her account, he/she will give the username and password of the student.
Question (New Student): How can we meet our teachers? Are we going to look or contact them, or they are the one who will contact us? Answer (Ms. Feranil): Each section has assigned Registration Adviser. They are the one tasked to look for the students and create a group for the class. Then later, all subject teachers will be added to the group, so that there will be only one group for each class to elicit confusion on the part of the student on how to communicate and whom.
Question (Irregular Student): How about if virtual class schedule is conflict with my back subjects, do I need to drop the subject? Answer (Ms. Anonas): No, flexible learning is self-paced and can do the learning even not during the virtual class schedule.
Question: How will the lesson be delivered? Is the lesson/module will be provided for the whole semester one at a time? Answer (Prof. Sedigo): Preparing a module is not the easy but almost all faculty have their modules for one month or until Midterm except for some that they really have prepared the whole module for one semester. So module delivery, is by lesson or chapter, so that you will not be overwhelmed by the lessons and the activities.
Program of Activities

Evaluation Results
CRITERIA PARENTS STUDENTS OVERALL Meeting your expectation 4.62 4.18 4.19 Attainment of the objectives 4.54 4.32 4.33 Topics discussed 4.69 4.47 4.47 Input presentation 4.69 4.17 4.18 Management team / Secretariat 4.62 4.29 4.30 Virtual arrangement 4.38 4.15 4.16 Over-all assessment 4.69 4.38 4.39 Overall Rating 4.60 4.28 4.29
Comments: 1. Every instructor is well-prepared to answer the questions. Even though comments' section was getting "flooded" by questions, they managed to answer almost all of them on time with also the help of Professor Noel. 2. Maayos naman yung naging virtual orientation at malinaw lahat .. 3. Nasagot naman po lahat ng tanong ko about sa new normal class maayos din po na naipahayag ang bawat detalye. 4. Maganda naman po yung presentation about sa ibat ibang modes of learning. naipakita rin po ang mga applications maaaring gamitin ng mga estudyante at naituro rin kung paano ito gamitin. naging malinaw naman ang orientation para sa lahat at nasagot din ang mga katanungan ng mga parents at students. 5. Wala pong sound at some point. un lang hehe 6. Very informative 7. Na deliver naman nila ng ayos ang online orientation suggestion kolang mag bigay sila ng warnings sa mga students na nag comment lang ng hindi maganda para bang nag papansin lang or make it private para hindi masali ang mga students na gusto lang mang bastos 8. Over-all po, okay naman po ang orientation na naganap. Maayos pong sinagot nang mga faculty members ang mga katanungan namin at nalinawan po ako. Laking tulong po sa amin ang ganitong orientation dahil natulungan po kaming mga estudyante at ang mga magulang na maintindihan ang bagong sistema ng pag-aaral ngayong panahon ng pandemya. 9. Ok naman po yung presentation and marami po ako facts na nalaman regarding sa online class and yung delivery po nung presentation maganda 10. It went well although there's some problem but it was fixed quickly. 11. naway sa susunod po ee medyo maayos yung live kasi nawalawala po kasi ee 12. Ang galing po ng graphic organiser o yung nagmamanage po ng graphics, tapos malinaw rin pong naipaliwanag ng maayos yung mga topic na kailangang malaman ng mga istudyante at magulang. Salamat po 13. Napaka maintindihin ng mga teachers. Thankyou. 14. Very creative 15. Overall the virtual presentation was good well explained but there's some technical problems. 16. For me it was good, and because of this virtual orientation I realized that Online learning is not so hard :) . God bless! 17. The virtual presentation and orientation itself was very satisfactory, necessary information were properly explained and elaborated as well. 18. All of the speakers are good, but there's some interruptions when it comes on presentation. 19. I'm so grateful to have the people who were trying their best to create the education be more effective. As a student, I'll pray for the faculty member of Cavsu. God Bless us. 20. Ok naman maayos at magandang nasagot lahat ng tanong ng parents at ng student napaka approachable po ng mga teachers. 21. Not properly set the audio 22. Thank you po na kahit medyo may technical problems eh nagawan pa din po ng paraan na maipaliwanag ng maayos ang dapat malaman naming mga estudyante.. Good job po!฀ Godbless..❤ 23. Well appreciated yung effort ng lahat ng bumuo at speaker ng virtual orientation. 24. Good job! I gather all of the information a to make a decision, which benefits for me in incoming new normal class. 25. Napaka ganda ng mga sinabi ni Dean ฀ at mga plano nya sarap sa pakinggan ❤

OSAS-QF-05 Republic of the Philippines CAVITE STATE UNIVERSITY Don Severino delas Alas Campus Indang, Cavite
NOTICE OF ADMISSION FROM OSAS Semester SY_
Dear Mr. / Ms. _:
Congratulations! We are glad to inform you that your application for admission has been approved for the following programs: First course choice: _
Second course choice: _ Third course choice: _
You may now follow these procedures: 1. Proceed to the Cashier’s Office (Administration Building) and pay your medical fee.
2. Proceed to the University Infirmary and present this Notice of Admission (NOA) & official receipt (OR) of your medical fee for your physical/medical examination.
3. Once the medical results are available, submit the original copies of High School Report Card, Certificate of Good Moral Character, result of your medical exam and this NOA to the Registrar’s Office for your registration.
Those who are interested to avail scholarships and other financial assistance (depending on the qualification) may inquire at the Scholarship and Financial Assistance
Unit at OSAS. Thank you very much. Sincerely yours,
Dean, OSAS
++++++++++++++++++to be filled-out by Guidance Office Personnel++++++++++++++++++

OSAS-QF-05 Republic of the Philippines CAVITE STATE UNIVERSITY Don Severino delas Alas Campus Indang, Cavite
NOTICE OF ADMISSION FROM OSAS Semester SY_
Dear Mr. / Ms. _:
Congratulations! We are glad to inform you that your application for admission has been approved for the following programs: First course choice: _
Second course choice: _ Third course choice: _
You may now follow these procedures: 1. Proceed to the Cashier’s Office (Administration Building) and pay your medical fee.
2. Proceed to the University Infirmary and present this Notice of Admission (NOA) & official receipt (OR) of your medical fee for your physical/medical examination.
3. Once the medical results are available, submit the original copies of High School Report Card, Certificate of Good Moral Character, result of your medical exam and this NOA to the Registrar’s Office for your registration.
Those who are interested to avail scholarships and other financial assistance (depending on the qualification) may inquire at the Scholarship and Financial Assistance
Unit at OSAS. Thank you very much. Sincerely yours,
Dean, OSAS

C. What is the most important lesson in life that you have learned during your stay at CvSUTreceMartires City Campus?
The most important lesson i’ve learned at CvSU is to be goal digger, to be an effective way to my co- student, to share my idea without conditions and last, to be competitive in all aspects because I know that I can do anything with a good heart, good decision and good mindset. Lahat ng paghihirapmapapagtagumpayan Be patient all the time. being resposible at all time Do not give up until you achieve your goal

Being competitive at the same time be better version of yourself. morally upright, globally competitive, being honest, opstimistic, and patience " no matter how hard the situation is, just study and strive and do not quit. " I learned to manage time, I learned how to socialize with different people and especially I learned how to stand on my own two feet without relying on other people Enjoy yet be responsible The important lesson in life that I learned in staying to CVSU is we need to know how to get along with a classmate that I can use when I have found a job and be friendly. Hard working and responsible Work hard and be competitive in a right way. Whatever obstacles may come along your way, like dust in our new school building go with the flow and dont give up while achieving your dreams. study hard to graduate and most of all do not give up Being independent and put alot of knowledge of this school To be globally competitive and morally upright individual. To be morally upright individual Need to study hard if want to get highier grade. The most important lesson in life that I have learned in this university is by being competitive and being independent because not all the people around you will help you in times of need. I've never forgotten about how you can value your time and effort in making your life worth. Most important lesson in life is you must believe that if they can, so can you Learn as much as you can, that doesn't mean studying all the time, it is important schedule time for fun and to take a break to keep your mind fresh and clear Magingmabuti Being a globally competetive individual Madami po akongnatutunansacvsutrecetulad ng pagigingisangmabutingkaibigan at mabaitsakapwamadami man po akongkalokohannanagawatulad ng pagigingpasawaysaklase at pala absent mas nangibabawnaman po ungsaya. The important lesson I have learned during my stay at CvSU is that staying at school is an investment for the future. You have to continue what you've start for your dream, because at the end of the day you will be successful and proud to your self. Proper use of time management Be strong and never give up on the things or dreams you want to achieve. The importance of time. Never give up Treasure the time Life doesn't get easier. Not all things will work out the way you planned but always desire to learn something useful. Never give up in pursuing your dreams. Time manage . Trust yourself, help yourself and aim for success Love of work Hardships comes with success. The most important thing in life that I've learned in my journey in CvSUTreceMartires City Campus is that I am not alone with my journey. My classmates became my sisters and brothers at school, listening and being with me when I have problems. Even if I'm a cry baby and a not so talkative person, they still accepted me for who I am. The instructors became our second parents. They keep on supporting us on what we wanted to do and motivate us not to give up on something we want to achieve. They never failed to show us their support to our talents and potentials. The knowledge and skills that we have

learned during our stay were really a treasure but the friendship that was made with pure intentions, over flowing love and support from the instructors, challenges that we conquered and the happiness that I felt from all those experiences were the things that will stay in my heart forever. In our course, the lesson in life that I have learned during my stay in the campus is that rather than doing it alone, working and brainstorming together as a group will achieve a more effective and efficient result. Teamwork while during any big activities like pre-employment seminar and culminating activities. The eagerness/willingness to learn despite the lack of facilities/resources I learned to socialize with my co-students, professors and staffs with different status in life, and became treasurer in League of Young Hotelier and Restaurateur (LYHR) 2019. I also learned that age gap is not a hindrance in achieving my goal to finish my study in college. Self-sustainability and Self-sufficiency be a professional and give effort to all gain your goal Rely on your self adaptability Always Do your best Time management and decision making Work hard for you goals
most important lesson i've learned in CVSU is to never give up even if the course is not easy To be on time Encourage your self even though theres so much struggling we face, it can't stop us to attend to school just to learn and strive more to reach our goal (to graduate) i have learn that, it doesn't matter if your school is small, atleast we learn. thanks to our professors who encourage us to keep on fighting in our studies and teach us to be better on our fields. Don't too rush the projects, just think about the best to see what the perfect/good result. you have to work hard for your dreams Give all the best in what you are doing Competitive, Focus and fellowship. Make every moment count The most valuable efforts are the ones never recognized. Self-study is a key to learn Give respect Hardwork and Teamwork Perseverance I learned to always look at the bright side of things. Morally upright and time management The most important lesson that I learned in CVSU Trece is yung wag ka umasasaiba, katuladna lang pagwalangmga prof na mag tuturo, dapathindipalalahatiaasasakanila, kasihindinamanlagisilangnadyan para mag turo o tulungan ka, dapatmatutunanmotumayosasarilimongmgapaananghindiumaasasakanila. I think yun Yung pinakamahalagangnatutunan ko sabuongapatnataongpag stay ko sacvsU, wag umasasamga prof. I have learned to be somehow independent when it comes to learning. The significance of self-studying was emphasized during my stay in CvSU. Aside from the fact that Instructors are not always present, the lessons are too broad, so, i have to explore more of it by myself. Time management Believe in yourself that anything is possible Learn to trust others especially yourself

One of the most important lesson I've learned is how to balance ,how to prioritize .Life is about balancing your job , family, friends,lovelife,and personal time . communication and technical skills and also commitment Self-esteem Different fundamentals in different subjects. Be Patient.. All things work together for good
D. Have you encountered any problems during your whole stay here at CvSUTreceMartires City Campus? If yes, please elaborate.
I never encountered any problems because for me, everything happens has a lesson. If I fail, i will try again and again until I fulfill. And I know that CvSUTrece always do the best for our future. Yesyung time naisangsemwalangkuryente Transportation and lack of food stalls No No problem. Very good all teacher and faculty No none Yes, when working on our thesis. It is really hard, but the help of our adviser she makes it easier for us ❤️ Not yet Minor problems The problem that I encounteres when I stay in CVSU is when itsraining , there is no place to be a shelter for us during breaktime. No Passages are muddy when it rains. It can cause accidents. None No No No No, I don't have any problem during my staying in CVSU. When i got pregnant, im struggling to get a high grade. Yes I encountered some of the problems mostly when clearance week. There are some time that you need their signatures but they are not present or they are busy so my only choice is to come back again and again and again when they are not busy. Also, in sports fest week, there are so many winners but they don’t give the respective medals for us. Some did’t receive medals and some receive medals but not for the right rank for them. None No None Yesnungwalangkuryente No Hhmmwalanaman po. Ang pinakanagingproblema ko lang is ang paggisingsaumaga kaya akolaging late at tamadmagreviewhehepero di yon naginghadlang para di akomakatapossatulong ng akingpamilya at sapanginoongmakapangyarihansalahat I dont remember i encountered worst problems. No no

No. Yes, using the toilet because its very dirty No No None Yes , As a irregular student is not easy because of the conflict schedule of the subject. None No. Yes,We don't have enough materials that we can use cor our activities. The first 2 years was really satisfying. But I really had a hard time adjusting to the new location of the school. For me, the location is much better before. The noise you can hear from other rooms became a problem for me because I can't really focus on the discussion. I have a hard time adapting to the new location. But, I think there can be an improvement on this because of the new plans that the school have. Lastly, the instructor/s with favoritism and being biased. Favoritism and being biased of some instructor. Too many dust sometimes that getting through the laboratory when the air is too much, need to close the windows to avoid any dust coming to your works like baking and cooking. As an HRM student, I find it difficult to perform tasks and activites with limited resources I have not encountered any problem during my stay in CVSU. Mainit, Maputik, etc. nope.. We don't have any area to stay when we have a vacant time. Yes, when one of our teacher doesn't know how to teach their lesson None yes, during the moving of the campus in osorio. We don't have electricity in the whole 2 semester but it's all good because the teaching are great. No There are some subjects where did not come close in finishing the syllabus due to some problems. Nothing Yes, especially sakakulangan ng mga prof. I mean madalaskasiwalayungmga prof kasipinapadala para

umatttend ng mga meeting daw, kaya ang nangyayariwalarin nag tuturosamin. Yes, one of the problems i have encountered was an unsatisfying instructor's teaching performance. to be honest, may mga subjects talagangnapakahirapintindihin because it's unfamiliar and di man lang kami na-guide man lang nangmaayos para matutunaniyon. di naman din minsannagtuturo. yungibabinabasahan lang kami then translate in tagalog then dismiss. sobrang rare lang ng prof na may natutunan kami sa subject no matter how unfamiliar or hard the lesson is. yungiba din hindipumapasok for whatever reasons man, umabot kami sa point na gusto nanamin ng may pasoknaman, ganun, kasilagina lang wala. i hope you will take this as a constructive criticism to improve the performance of some intsructors and won't take it as an offending comment kasi we do appreciate naman the efforts ng mga instructors especially nungmganakikita naming nagsisikapnamangmagturo, there are "some" lang talagananaencounternamin, and for the fact nasinabihankaming "pinag-experiment-uhan", medyoibasa feeling. thinking na, siguro, one of the reasons why these things happened? just thinking. Yes, I've met a new gay instructor who is a maniac and he is using his position to manipulate students. I have never been his victim. I am a pure & I am a Christian so I rather failed my subjects than selling my dignity. But in the end God is great, God creates miracle so I graduated the same year as my classmates. None None We don't have any place to stay when we have a vacant time. unprofessional instructors and no electrical power whole semester Comfort room/maputek/lack of facilities Yes, hard time studying. 5. General Evaluation towards Physical Facilities and Environment
Hindi maayosyunglugar or nilalakarannamin but hindiyunrason para mag reklamo, ang importante may sariling school at masisipagna employees and instructors. Di masyadongnaalagaan ng maayosperonapapanatilingmalinis Please renovate the CR and add maintenance personnel yes Not good specially the comfort room Lack of facilities more improvement in comfort room (cr) 4 years of staying in cvsu, they really maintain the cleanliness of our school. Yes Lack of facilities When it comes to facilities in school , there's a steel that is rusty, and can't do activities in room because theres a lot students that will be affected and the floor shakes when someone runs. Excellent Not so perfect and so much flaws to be honest but I love and wholeheartly accepted my Alma Mater. place when we have vacant time, CVSU Trece should have own facilities for students when they vacant time for them to not go somewhere . the surroundings are dusty especially when it is sunny and windy Good N/A Facilities need more rooms to other students but other rooms are comfortable. The facilities and environment is all good. Maybe they should improve the physical facility of the university for the students.
95% None For the environment mahiraplalonakapagmaulankasesobrangputik at malayo din ang school sa bayan kasepag vacant time ang mga student doon nakatambaysagubatgubathindinatenalamna kung safe ba dun, May na experience kame nakaen kame sa canteen at may nakita kame ng lalakenanakahubadsaibabayun ay nakatitig lang samenhanggangsamatapos kame kumaen. Good Para sa akin masayaako nag aralsacvsutrecedahilsadalangsarap ng simoy ng hanginmaputiknga lang minsankapagnaulanhaha Improve facilities and environment. Needs development Good environment, Hope you can fix the comfort rooms and maintain cleanliness. The facilities and environment is ok because of the good nature in cvsutrece. Needs Improvement Good In my opinion the physical facilities and environment are not really good but we should not judge it by its appearance because they offer a better quality of education. None g It was good and it'll be better if it has complete facilities specially on laboratories. N/A I hope students can have a better facilities and materials that they can use for their studies. I am worried with the physical facilities because when someone is running at the 2nd floor, you can really feel the building is kinda shaking. You can hear noises to adjacent rooms. And when it's raining, some rooms have mud on the floors. Personally, i think the physical facilities of the whole school is the problem. You cannot focus on class because of the noises in the adjacent room. The weather is also a factor. When summer, you cannot focus in class because it is too hot that sometimes resulted in passing out of spme students. The restrooms are not decent and clean and the roads are not in cement, so when it rains it really hard to walk to school. Need some improvement in the restroom, hallways and in rooms in the second floor it is shakin when someone is running. Cavite State University-TreceMartires Campus Physical facilities looks good, but insufficient and hot classroom; HRM laboratory is too small.
